data.title: CHAPTER XVI What One Might Call Religion among the Savage Americans: Of the Errors in Which Certain Charlatans Called Caraïbes Hold Them in Thrall; and of the Great Ignorance of God in Which They Are
data.meta_description: CHAPTER XVI What One Might Call Religion among the Savage Americans: Of the Errors in Which Certain Charlatans Called Caraïbes Hold Them in Thrall; and of the Great Ignorance of God in Which They Are Plunged was published in History of a Voyage to the Land of Brazil on page 134.
